result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Nicole Legener

Defendant Michelle Nicole Legener in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Michelle Nicole Legener.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Dennis Patrick Murphy for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea/sentencing hearing. Defense was recently appointed and requested adjournment of proceedings. Case remains in resolution posture. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Michelle Nicole Legener in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont for Amanda Poznanski.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to SPD Poznanski's health issue,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Michelle Nicole Legener not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Court is advised that defendant is facing a revocation on a withheld sentence.
Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for status.
State recommends adjournment for plea hearing; no objection by defense counsel.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Attorney Ashley Fard, appearing for Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Michelle Nicole Legener not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both parties appear in person.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Michelle Nicole Legener in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Michelle Nicole Legener in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is re-assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28 due to the nature of the charge and the intake schedule.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AM
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Michelle Nicole Legener in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Michelle Nicole Legener in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michelle Nicole Legener appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
